alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 12:27AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hot Springs, southwestern Big Horn, northwestern Washakie and eastern Park Counties through 115 AM MDT... At 1227 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Dead Indian Pass to 6 miles west of Anchor Dam. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Anchor Dam around 1240 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Ralston, Hamilton Dome, Powell, Thermopolis, Garland and Hot Springs State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
